capsules_submitted.utterance:
You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. I mean, who wouldn't want to be "the boy who lived" after all? It's an incredible feeling to have that kind of power and responsibility on your shoulders.

But what really gets me is how he grew up from being this scared kid to becoming a brave and selfless hero. He's truly an inspiration, and I think that's why J.K. Rowling created him in the first place - to show us all that even in the darkest times, there's always hope for a better tomorrow.

I remember reading the books as a kid, and every time I thought about Harry, I felt this sense of excitement and wonder. He's just so... relatable, you know? And yet, at the same time, he's also incredibly unique and special. That's what makes him such an amazing character, in my opinion.

Anyway, have you read the books or seen the movies? What do you think about Harry's story?
